title: While most complain about rylais...
body: {{champion:81}}  with {{item:3025}}  has been doing something similar to {{item:3116}}  users. > [{quoted}](name=XTRMN00B1337,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tnv8RLx4,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-24T22:23:26.828+0000)
>
> It was satire. what I was trying to say is winrates don't make a champion balanced.

Balance is highly subjective. What one person considers to be "balanced" another person may consider broken/unhealthy. Balancing this game is like politics. People have different opinions and we won't always agree on anything. However, win rates/play rates etc cannot be disputed. 2+2 will always equal four. My point is numbers don't lie! Even though you believe he's broken, the numbers tell a different story.

Numbers don't lie, but you have to look at the right numbers.

A 49% win rate on Ezreal means nothing, by itself. What you need to look at is the win rate in which he uses iceborn, and consider the experience of the user when you look at that number.

And balance is not subjective. There can be debate about a topic without it being subjective. The definition of balanced implies objectivity. You have a point in there about how different people would use different strategies to balance the game, and perhaps different metrics to measure it, but that doesn't mean that the ideal of balance is subjective.

I disagree completely with this. There is no such thing as a wrong number. Regardless of where the information comes from, these are REAL facts that cannot be disputed. And it really doesn't matter what build Ezreal uses. He uses multiple builds based on the enemy team. But since you brought up IBG, let me mention that he actually has a 46% win rate with it. I'd also like to point out that Ezreal is one of the only adc's without cc (Lucian and Sivir also have this problem). IBG slightly helps with this problem, but as stated by others he sacrifices a TON of damage for it. And again the ability that applies the slow is a skillshot, just like everything else in his kit. Almost all of Ezreal's damage can be avoided/reduced if you're good at dodging skillshots (or if you have minions to block them for you).

And yes balance is completely subjective. Champions are balanced around personal tastes/wants instead of what's healthy for the game.

There IS such a thing as a wrong correlation. 

http://www.tylervigen.com/spurious-correlations

The number isn't what's wrong, it's the interpretation. Basically, saying that win rate directly correlates to health is a logical fallacy because **correlation does not imply causation.** In scientific inquiry, the interpretation matters AT LEAST AS MUCH, if not more, than the data. That's widely accepted in science, and those same principles apply to the data collected in a video game.

Saying that "balance is subjective" like it's a fact is ludicrous. No sane designer wants balance that is subjective. Again, you are mixing up fact with interpretation. We all interpret balance decisions differently, but the ideal can still be objective. You're just plain wrong on that.

"Balanced" isn't the right word.

"Unhealthy" is a better one.

Although it does vary, if it's consistent over time, that champion tends to be a proble,

{{champion:105}} for example

I was trying to explain how

"unhealthy" refers to the poor experience of playing as/with/against a champion 

"balance" refers to the strength of the champion

the confusion is because most OP champions (aka, "imbalanced") indeed have unhealthy gameplay. The difference between the two descriptions can be found because you can have an unhealthy kit yet still not be imbalanced

As in, ranged champions can buy it, but the armor pen is only applied by melee auto attacks/damage? or what?

No, ranged champions can't buy it. Only duel range and melee champions can.

However, no matter what version of range you are, if you could buy it the passive will apply. So Gnar in ranged form can use the passive because he's duel range thus being able to buy it. However Lucian can't buy it at all.

I strongly disagree with that.  It's absolutely essential to Gnar.  Other ranged champions didn't build it before crit was nerfed and the damage on cleaver was buffed.  the season 5 stats on black cleaver worked fine.

> No, ranged champions can't buy it. Only duel range and melee champions can.

> However, no matter what version of range you are, if you could buy it the passive will apply. So Gnar in ranged form can use the passive because he's duel range thus being able to buy it. However Lucian can't buy it at all.

it would mean that the passives wouldn't apply in mini gnar though, which means his damage would be vastly less.  i would love to see systemic changes that would allow that kind of thing, but it would also allow some ranged champions to get tiamat (titanic hydra gnar would be terrifying), give full benefit of fervor/grasp to gnar, etc.  i don't really think the tradeoffs are worth it.  keep in mind that armor pen is also better the more you have of it, so since armor pen will be weaker early, crit builds will be stronger in comparison and black cleaver may be weaker on adc as a result.  if not, then at least only champions it makes sense on will use it.  nerfing the ad will also make it worse on the adcs that build it currently, while not hurting the bruiser champions that rely mostly on base damage as much.  it's really the armor shred, health, and cdr they care about, so buffing the health and nerfing the AD would help fix the problem without creating much larger systematic problems

> it would mean that the passives wouldn't apply in mini gnar though, which means his damage would be vastly less

I clearly said the PASSIVE WOULD apply on mini gnar. I only said **ranged champions, excluding duel range, CANNOT buy the item.**. A similar thing happened with Tiamat and Kayle, where she could buy it and apply an AoE despite being in her ranged mode.

it's the same idea as runaan's hurricane.  dual range champs can buy them, but the passive only applies when the champion is in ranged, or for the tiamat items it only applies in melee.  the tiamat and kayle interaction was probably a bug.  according to the wiki: "This item's active cannot be used by ranged champions.
Shapeshifting champions can only use Crescent while classified as melee. This includes Kayle Kayle, who is considered a ranged champion while Righteous Fury.png Righteous Fury is active, Nidalee Nidalee when using Aspect of the Cougar.png Aspect of the Cougar, Jayce Jayce while in Transform- Mercury Hammer.png Hammer stance, Elise Elise while in Spider Form.png Spider Form."

all dual range champions could buy it, but it would be useless for them.

based off of current precedents, melee only wouldn't work.  i doubt rito would change the way items are classified just for one item.  they didn't seem to have a big problem with adcs building black cleaver anyways, more just that the adcs were only building armor pen instead of crit.  if lethality isn't that good on adcs, then we're going to see crit builds again, and essence reaver will displace black cleaver for adcs.

And that's why you see a regular cycle of "Make Iceborn Gaunlet  melee only" threads.
Ezreal is one champion and so he can be balanced around gauntlet. Rylais gives permaslow to an entire class of champions.

The only way to really balance Ezreal around any on-hit effects that he continually abuses is to remove on-hit application from his Q.  Until they do that, they will have to nerf/balance all on-hit items that Ez can abuse.
if they removed on-hit effects, they would have to buff it a different way.  it would be interesting if they tried replacing on-hit applications with making it able to crit

or nerf the amount of effectiveness of on-hit. Maybe make it have only 75% the effectiveness or something, experiment a bit and see what happens, though I imagine his builds would be homogenized into one of the armor pen builds we're seeing on Lucian and MF right now, since building tons of AD and arpen would be what makes his Q hurt. They'd probably have to give his Q or some other parts of his kit compensation buffs if the removed its ability to apply on-hit, too.
But why? It's not like Ezreal is OP or anything. He's pretty balanced right now, has clear strengths and weaknessess.
I'm not suggesting that we do go through with that course of action, I'm suggesting what should happen if that's the decision that is made.
